Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object

  • public final class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class that has various methods that are used in the app.

    rozsa

      • setupDiscardDoneBar

        public static void setupDiscardDoneBar(Activity activity,
                       View.OnClickListener discardListener,
                       View.OnClickListener doneListener)
        Creates a Discard/Done bar in an activity and allows OnClickListeners to be attached.

        Parameters:
        activity - non-null
        discardListener - listener for the discard button; can be null
        doneListener - listener for the done button; can be null

        Returns:
        Android resource string id

      • nonNullOrThrow

        public static <T> T nonNullOrThrow(T object,
                   java.lang.String name)
        Ensures the object is not null, then returns the same reference. Otherwise, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown with the name given.

        Example: 

         final String stringThatMaybeNull = …;
 final String stringThatCantBeNull = ClaimUtils.nonNullOrThrow(stringThatMaybeNull, "s");
 stringThatCantBeNull.trim();  // this line will never crash from NullPointerException
        Type Parameters:
        T - any object type, it will be the return type
        Parameters:
        object - the object to check for nullity
        name - the name of the object (for Exception message)
        Returns:
        the original object, if not null

      • nonNullNonEmptyOrThrow

        public static java.lang.String nonNullNonEmptyOrThrow(java.lang.String string,
                                      java.lang.String name)
        Ensures the String is not null or empty, then returns the same String. Otherwise, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown with the name given.

        Example: 

         final String stringThatMaybeNullOrEmpty = …;
 final String stringThatCantBeNullOrEmpty = ClaimUtils.nonNullOrThrow(stringThatMaybeNullOrEmpty, "s");
 stringThatCantBeNull.isEmpty();  // always false (and won't crash)
        Parameters:
        string - the String to check for nullity
        name - the name of the object (for Exception message)
        Returns:
        the original String, if not null or empty
